required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long Term Follow-Up Study 16-20 Years After Hepatitis B Vaccination in Newborns of Mothers Who Were Seropositive for Hepatitis B Envelope Antigen (HBeAg) & Hepatitis B Surface Antigen (HBsAg)
clinical_study.official_title: Long-term Follow-Up Studies at Years 16-20, to Evaluate the Persistence of Immune Response of GSK Biologicals' Hepatitis B Vaccine in Newborns of HBeAg+ and HBsAg+ Mothers in Comparison With a Historical Control Group

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is performed to evaluate the persistence of anti-hepatitis B surface antigen (HBs) antibodies up to 16, 17, 18, 19 and 20 years after administration of the first dose of the study vaccine, Engerix-B™. No new subjects will be recruited in this long-term follow-up study.
The Protocol Posting has been updated in order to comply with the FDA Amendment Act, Sep 2007.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary study was to evaluate the immunogenicity and protective efficacy of hepatitis B vaccine administered according to a 0, 1, 2, 12 month schedule in newborns of anti-hepatitis B envelope antigen positive (HBeAg+) and anti-hepatitis B surface antigen positive (HBsAg+) mothers. Results from the primary study have shown that the vaccine was immunogenic and protected neonates of HBeAg positive mothers against hepatitis B chronic carriage. The present study is carried out to evaluate the anti-HBs persistence and the prevalence and incidence of other hepatitis B markers (HBsAg, anti-hepatitis B core antigen {anti-HBc}, HBeAg, Alanine aminotransferase/Aspartate aminotransferase {ALT/AST}), and the clinical significance of the HBsAg and anti-HBc positive cases observed during the long-term from year 16-20. No vaccine will be administered during the long term follow up period.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Seropositive for Anti-hepatitis B Surface Antigen (Anti-HBs) Antibodies
primary_outcome.time_frame: At Years 16, 17, 18, 19 and 20 after primary vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Seropositive subjects are subjects with anti-HBs antibody concentration ≥ 3.3 mIU/mL.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Tested Positive for Markers of Infection With Hepatitis B Virus
primary_outcome.time_frame: At Years 16, 17, 18,19 and 20 after primary vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Tested markers were hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg), antibody to hepatitis B core antigen (anti-HBc), hepatitis B envelope antigen (HBeAg) and antibody to hepatitis B envelope antigen (anti-HBe).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Chronic and With Clinical HBV Infection
primary_outcome.description: Chronic HBV infection: HBsAg+ and anti-HBc+ at more than 2 consecutive time points. Clinical HBV infection: Serologically confirmed, symptomatic HBV infection, and all HBV markers negative at consecutive time point.

arm_group.description: Newborns of anti-hepatitis B surface antigen positive [HBsAg(+)] and hepatitis B envelope antigen negative [HBeAg(-)] mothers, who received 4 doses of Engerix™ in the primary study.
Newborns of anti-hepatitis B surface antigen positive [HBsAg(+)] and hepatitis B envelope antigen positive [HBeAg(+)] mothers, who received 4 doses of Engerix™ in the primary study.
Newborns of anti-hepatitis B surface antigen positive [HBsAg(+)] and hepatitis B envelope antigen positive [HBeAg(+)] mothers, who received 5 doses of Engerix™ in the primary study.
Newborns of anti-hepatitis B surface antigen negative [HBsAg(-)] and hepatitis B envelope antigen negative [HBeAg(-)] mothers, who received 4 doses of Engerix™ in the primary study.

intervention.description: A blood sample will be taken yearly at each long-term follow-up time point (i.e. Year 16 through Year 20) after the first dose of Engerix-B™ vaccine.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who had participated in the primary study.
- Written informed consent obtained from the subject.

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

reference.citation: Poovorawan Y, Chongsrisawat V, Theamboonlers A, Srinivasa K, Hutagalung Y, Bock HL, Hoet B. Long-term benefit of hepatitis B vaccination among children in Thailand with transient hepatitis B virus infection who were born to hepatitis B surface antigen-positive mothers. J Infect Dis. 2009 Jul 1;200(1):33-8. doi: 10.1086/599331.

Poovorawan Y et al. Persistence of anti-HBs antibodies and immune memory 20-years after hepatitis B vaccination among children in Thailand. Abstract presented at the 9th International Congress of Tropical Pediatrics (ICTP). Bangkok, Thailand. 18-20 October 2011.

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participant Flow and Baseline measures are given for the year 20 time point in order to account for all subjects participating in this long-term follow-up study. Note that not all subjects returned and participated in each of the intermediate follow-up time points.

group.title: HBsAg(+) & HBeAg(+) 5-dose Group
group.description: Newborns of anti-hepatitis B surface antigen positive [HBsAg(+)] and hepatitis B envelope antigen positive [HBeAg(+)] mothers, who received 5 doses of Engerix™ in the primary study.

group.title: HBsAg(+) & HBeAg(-) 4-dose Group
group.description: Newborns of HBsAg(+) and HBeAg negative [HBeAg(-)] mothers, who received 4 doses of Engerix™ in the primary study.

group.description: Newborns of HBsAg(+) and HBeAg(+) mothers, who received 4 doses of Engerix™ in the primary study.

group.title: HBsAg(-) & HBeAg(-) 4-dose Group
group.description: Newborns of HBsAg(-) and HBeAg(-) mothers, who received 4 doses of Engerix™ in the primary study.

group.description: Newborns of anti-hepatitis B surface antigen positive [HBsAg(+)] and hepatitis B envelope antigen positive [HBeAg(+)] mothers, who received 5 doses of Engerix™ in the primary study.

group.title: HBsAg(+) & HBeAg(-) 4-dose Group
group.description: Newborns of HBsAg(+) and HBeAg negative [HBeAg(-)] mothers, who received 4 doses of Engerix™ in the primary study.

group.title: HBsAg(+) & HBeAg(+) 4-dose Group

group.title: HBsAg(-) & HBeAg(-) 4-dose Group
group.description: Newborns of HBsAg(-) and HBeAg(-) mothers, who received 4 doses of Engerix™ in the primary study.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Seropositive for Anti-hepatitis B Surface Antigen (Anti-HBs) Antibodies
outcome.description: Seropositive subjects are subjects with anti-HBs antibody concentration ≥ 3.3 mIU/mL.
outcome.time_frame: At Years 16, 17, 18, 19 and 20 after primary vaccination
outcome.population: The analyses were performed on the Long-Term According to protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity. Due to subjects being lost to follow up or eliminated from the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, no data from subjects in HBsAg(+) & HBeAg(-) 4-dose Group and HBsAg(-) & HBeAg(-) 4-dose Group were analyzed.

group.title: HBsAg(+) & HBeAg(+) 5-dose Group
group.description: Newborns of anti-hepatitis B surface antigen positive [HBsAg(+)] and hepatitis B envelope antigen positive [HBeAg(+)] mothers, who received 5 doses of Engerix™ in the primary study.

group.title: HBsAg(+) & HBeAg(-) 4-dose Group
group.description: Newborns of HBsAg(+) and HBeAg negative [HBeAg(-)] mothers, who received 4 doses of Engerix™ in the primary study.

group.title: HBsAg(+) & HBeAg(+) 4-dose Group
group.description: Newborns of HBsAg(+) and HBeAg(+) mothers, who received 4 doses of Engerix™ in the primary study.

group.title: HBsAg(-) & HBeAg(-) 4-dose Group
group.description: Newborns of HBsAg(-) and HBeAg(-) mothers, who received 4 doses of Engerix™ in the primary study.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Seropositive for Anti-hepatitis B Surface Antigen (Anti-HBs) Antibodies
measure.description: Seropositive subjects are subjects with anti-HBs antibody concentration ≥ 3.3 mIU/mL.
measure.population: The analyses were performed on the Long-Term According to protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity. Due to subjects being lost to follow up or eliminated from the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, no data from subjects in HBsAg(+) & HBeAg(-) 4-dose Group and HBsAg(-) & HBeAg(-) 4-dose Group were analyzed.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Who Tested Positive for Markers of Infection With Hepatitis B Virus
outcome.description: Tested markers were hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg), antibody to hepatitis B core antigen (anti-HBc), hepatitis B envelope antigen (HBeAg) and antibody to hepatitis B envelope antigen (anti-HBe).
outcome.time_frame: At Years 16, 17, 18,19 and 20 after primary vaccination
outcome.population: The analyses were performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity. Only subjects positive for HBsAg or anti-HBc markers were tested for HBeAg and anti-HBe markers for Year 17 to Year 20.

group.title: HBsAg(+) & HBeAg(+) 5-dose Group

measure.population: The analyses were performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity. Only subjects positive for HBsAg or anti-HBc markers were tested for HBeAg and anti-HBe markers for Year 17 to Year 20.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: No safety data were collected during this long-term follow-up study.
